body_html: PyTorch internally uses pickle and it's a limitation of pickle. You can try meddling with sys.path to include the directory where module.py is. This is exactly why we recommend saving only the state dicts and not whole model objects.
body_text: PyTorch internally uses pickle and it's a limitation of pickle. You can try meddling with sys.path to include the directory where module.py is. This is exactly why we recommend saving only the state dicts and not whole model objects.
body: PyTorch internally uses `pickle` and it's a limitation of pickle. You can try meddling with `sys.path` to include the directory where `module.py` is. This is exactly why we recommend saving only the state dicts and not whole model objects.
